verbose_text: Certain studies claim that activation of ERK1/2, but not JNKs or the p38 MAPKs, promotes osteogenesis, whereas others state that p38 MAPKs promote osteogenic differentiation.
evidence: ERK1/2, but not JNKs or the p38 MAPKs, promotes osteogenesis              , whereas others state that p38 MAPKs promote osteogenic differentiation
